By default, the whole project XML will be transformed using the XSLT files. In order to avoid rendering objects outside the current document it is necessary using plug-ins.
Proteus standart `basics` plug-in (`<pluginDependency name="basics"/>`) allows to access the current selected document in XSLT by calling a Python function in the XSL code.
The following `xsl:template` match can be added at the end of the "main" XSL file after all the includes: ``` xml <xsl:template match="project"> <xsl:variable name="currentDocumentId" select="proteus-utils:current_document()"/> <xsl:for-each select="documents"> <xsl:if test="object[@id=$currentDocumentId]"> <xsl:apply-templates select="object[@id=$currentDocumentId]"/> </xsl:if> </xsl:for-each> </xsl:template> ```
This allows applying the transformation just to the document objects but still have access to other documents objects in case it is necessary.
